text:
We just released *Pluto 0.14*! This release is all about laying the groundwork for exciting new features, highlights include:
• An overhaul of Pluto’s networked state management (<https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/710|#710>), which allows us to 
    ◦ implement exciting new features much more quickly in the future, like (<https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/891|#891>), (<https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/844|#844>) and (<https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/437|#437>)
    ◦ dynamically switch between a static preview, a “slider server” and a live session, without having to refresh the browser (this technology powers <http://computationalthinking.mit.edu|computationalthinking.mit.edu> and <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/811|#811> and <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/988|#988>)
• Lots of stability improvements, fixed some race conditions
• “Soft interrupt” on Windows (<https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/pull/932|#932>)
The <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/compare/v0.12.19...v0.14.0|git diff> tells us that this release will bring you:
• 38 merged pull requests from 19 contributors
• 160 commits
• 6000 additions and 3000 deletions to 103 files _(excluding computer-generated files)_
Enjoy! Thank you to everyone who contributed, through code changes, feedback or otherwise!

text:
and a fun fact! Pluto’s source code is now partially written as Pluto notebooks! <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/blob/main/src/webserver/Firebasey.jl>
(just like PlutoUI!)
